Interface ec.encoding.Encodable

public interface interface Encodable
This interface is for objects which are interested in having themselves passed through a comm system as something other than what they really are. When asked to encode itself, the object hands back an EncodedObject, which itself consists of a Decoder and two arrays of objects: The Decoder is the object to be asked to decode the arrays into an object. One array of arguments is the set of preface arguments, and the second array is the array of body arguments. See ec.encoding.Decoder for further details.

See Also:
Decoder, EncodedObject

encode()
Encode this object.

encode 
 public abstract EncodedObject encode()
Encode this object. The encoded form is merely a Decoder plus a pair of arrays of objects. If there is a reference to this object in the Decoder itself or in the preface array, it effectively becomes a reference by proxy to the original on decoding. If there is a reference to this object in the body array, it becomes a normal recursive reference.

Returns:
the encoded form of this object
